title: Feuerbach point
summary: In the geometry of triangles, the incircle and nine-point circle of a triangle are internally tangent to each other at the Feuerbach point of the triangle. The Feuerbach point is a triangle center, meaning that its definition does not depend on the placement and scale of the triangle. It is listed as X(11) in Clark Kimberling's  Encyclopedia of Triangle Centers, and is named after Karl Wilhelm Feuerbach.[1][2]
